page.title: 03CORBRIDGE PARISH COUNCIL
page.content: Corbridge Parish Council was first set up in 1894.The elected Councillors are there to serve the interests of the ward of Corbridge and Dilston.It is a statutory body with formal powers of procedure as prescribed by law. Local councillors have the task of ensuring that the voice of the parishioners are heard.In recent months a parishioner complained about the lack of adequate street lighting near her home; it was agreed that a light be erected.At the beginning of each financial year the Council set a rate.The biggest single item of cost to Corbridge is the upkeep of the cemetery.The Clerk to the Council has the task of dealing with the correspondence and looking into the legal and financial committment on behalf of the Council.The Council also consider all planning applictions.
